title: If the selling price of 18 oranges is equal to the cost price of 16 oranges, what is the gain or loss percentage? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends….! Let cost price of one orange be ₹x Thus cost price of 16 oranges will be 16x Selling price of 18 oranges will be 16x Selling price of one orange is 16x/18 = 0.8888x We know Loss % = (cost price - selling price)/cost price ×100 Loss% = (x - 0.8888x)/x × 100 = 0.1112x/x × 100 = 0.1112 × 100 = 11.12% There was 11.12% Loss on sale of oranges Answer: There was 11 12% Loss in sale of oranges

Let's assume that cost price of 1 orange is Rs.10. So c.p.of 16 oranges would be 160. Now 18 oranges were sold for 160.Thus s.p. of each orange =160÷18=Rs.8.9 As c.p. is more than s.p. there is loss. The loss percentage =(10-8.9)×100=11%
